questions.question: She asked, 'Where do you live?' → She asked where I ___.
questions.explanation: Present simple in direct questions becomes past simple.

questions.question: He asked, 'What are you doing?' → He asked what I ___ doing.
They asked, 'Did you see the movie?' → They asked if I ___ the movie.
questions.explanation: Past simple becomes past perfect in reported questions.

questions.question: She asked, 'Can you help me?' → She asked if I ___ help her.
He asked, 'Have you finished your homework?' → He asked if I ___ my homework.
They asked, 'Where did you go?' → They asked where I ___ .
questions.explanation: Past simple becomes past perfect in reported questions.

questions.question: She asked, 'Why are you crying?' → She asked why I ___ crying.
He asked, 'Will you be there?' → He asked if I ___ be there.
They asked, 'What time does it start?' → They asked what time it ___.
I asked, 'Where is the station?' → I asked where the station ___ .
He asked, 'Do you like coffee?' → He asked if I ___ coffee.
She asked, 'When will you arrive?' → She asked when I ___ arrive.
They asked, 'Are you okay?' → They asked if I ___ okay.
He asked, 'What have you done?' → He asked what I ___ done.
She asked, 'Could you open the window?' → She asked if I ___ open the window.
questions.explanation: 'Could' usually stays the same in reported speech.
